page.title: 06F.OF DEAN DRIFT MINE CONT..
page.content:
{ { THE SEAM IS FOUR FEET SIX AT THE THINNEST POINT & FIVE FEET SIX AT THE WIDEST. ONCE THEY HAVE USED THE EXPLOSIVES THEY BREAK UP THE COAL WITH PICK AXES. THERE IS A LOT OF FOOLS GOLD IN THE COAL WHICH SHOWS IT IS GOOD COAL. THE PIT PROPS CALLED COGS ARE MADE OF WOOD. THEY ARE USED TO HOLD UP THE ROOF OF THE MINE.
THE COAL IS BROUGHT OUT OF THE MINE IN DRAMS ON DRAM LINES. EACH DRAM CARRIES HALF A TON. TO MAKE THE DRAM RUN SMOOTHLY OIL IS PUT ON THE REELS. ON THE BACK OF THE DRAMS THERE IS A METAL ROD TO STOP THE DRAMS SLIDING BACK DOWN THE MINE. THERE IS A SIGNAL TO SAY WHEN THE DRAM COMES UP THE MINE; ONE PULL FOR STOP, TWO FOR LOWER & THREE FOR RAISE. {CONT. PAGE 7... }
